p: One factor that is crucial for peopleâ€™s motivation to mitigate climate change is the extent to which people believe or doubt that climate change is real and will have serious effects. If people are sceptical about climate change, it is unlikely that they will act upon it. In line with this reasoning, some studies showed that higher levels of scepticism are associated with lower levels of endorsement of mitigation [ 9, 12]. Others, however, have found no relationship between scepticism and mitigation [ 13, 14].
